column4: At any time, you may reveal yourself to the town as Mr Good. Henceforth, your vote will count for 3. // You may not join any night chats once you have revealed yourself.
Once per game, you may choose a dead player to revive. They die at the end of the next night.
Capture a player for the night and talk to them anonymously. // Twice per game, you may deal a strong attack to your jailed captive. // You may not capture the same player twice.
Choose a player to bounce off. You bounce along their visit chain, visiting each player in turn, until the chain ends or repeats. Learn the alignment of the final player.
Visit a player to investigate them, narrowing down their role to five possibilities.
Visit two players. You learn whether they are the same alignment. // You may not visit the same player twice.
Visit a player. You learn the identities of anyone visiting them for the first time.

Visit a player with the intent of investigating them, although you immediately forget what you have learned. // Anyone who visits you is also lost to your memory. // Once per game, you may spend a night recalling the roles you have forgotten (but not the corresponding players). Each role is only listed once, even if it is in your memory multiple times.
Visit three players. If they are all different alignments, you learn each of their roles; otherwise, you learn nothing.
Choose any dead player. You learn their night results from the phase they died.
Thrice per game, you may learn either the role names OR identities (your choice) of everyone who visits you.
Choose any set of 4 players. You learn whether the group consists of more boys, more girls, or an even split.
Each night, you learn the names of any other players visited by the Mafia at least once that cycle. // You cannot speak in night chats (though you may be added to them).
Visit a player to learn the archetype of their role (but not their alignment).
Check a player's alignment. // The alignment you learn will be wrong.
Visit a player to protect them. // If they are attacked, you will take the attack on their behalf, and deal an attack to their attacker.
Visit a player to protect them from attacks. // The first time you are attacked, you automatically choose to protect yourself instead.

Coat someone in protective jelly, saving them from the next standard attack they incur. // Jelly lasts indefinitely until attacked, but you may only have jelly on two people at a time. // During the day, remove jelly from a player.
Visit a player to shine radiant light at them, shielding them from evil energy. Any actions by non-town players (aside from attacks) will be unable to affect them.

Once during the game, you may protect yourself and deal a standard attack to everyone who visits you. This action cannot be roleblocked. // For each player you attack, you gain a charge of the above ability.
Visit a player to scare them, dealing a standard attack. // If you kill a town member you will die immediately.
Twice per game, you may hop into someone's pocket during the day. They will feel you in there. // At the end of the night, they are dealt a Strong attack.
Visit a player and guess their rolename. If you are correct, you will turn them upside-down, dealing them a standard attack. If they die, their role will not be revealed.
Twice during the game, you may choose to become untargetable. All actions on you will fail. // You learn what would have happened to you on that phase.

If you do not cast a vote during the day, your vote power is carried over to the following day. This can be stacked indefinitely. // If you are lynched, any Mafia who voted for you loses their ability for the night.
Check a player's alignment. // Protect a player. // Attack a player. // Invite a player to a night chat. // You may only use each ability once.
Thrice per game, visit a player to help them out during the day. That night, they may use a limited ability without charge, or an unlimited ability twice. // You may not help the same player twice.
Visit a player to give them a hug, protecting them from attacks. // While being hugged, they are unable to use any actions.
Visit a player to distract them, preventing them from taking any actions.
Visit a player to silently force them (and all their visitors) to target you instead.
Choose two players and mix up their positions. // Choose two players and mix up their targets. // You may only use one action per night and may only target each player once.
You can converse freely and openly with the dead during each night phase.
During the day, create a private night chat with any number of people. // The total size of all your chats (including you) may not exceed the player count.
Send out invites to your party during the day! Everyone who votes for you joins your night chat (unless you are lynched).
Post anything you want in announcements (it is clear it is from a player).
You may quietly perform the faction kill without visiting your target. You cannot be roleblocked or controlled.
column5: Eliminate all opponents of the Mafia.

column4: Pop up outside your target's house, lying in wait for a specific player. If they visit your target, you deal a standard attack, but your name is revealed to any other visitors.
column5: Eliminate all opponents of the Mafia.

column4: Spin up a protective shield around a player of your choice, protecting them from standard attacks.
column5: Eliminate all opponents of the Mafia.

column4: Visit a player and use your big brain to deduce their role.
column5: Eliminate all opponents of the Mafia.

column4: Each night you learn the names of all players in night chats. // Once per game, you may choose a chat to eavesdrop: you can read through it the next day.
column5: Eliminate all opponents of the Mafia.

column4: Peer over someone's shoulder to watch where they go at night and learn which players visit them.
column5: Eliminate all opponents of the Mafia.

column4: You appear as town when investigated, and are immune to standard attacks. // Once per game, you may permanently become any other non-Killing Mafia role from the rolelist. // You may not perform the faction kill.
column5: Eliminate all opponents of the Mafia.

column4: During the day, create a private night chat with any number of people.
column5: Eliminate all opponents of the Mafia.

column4: Mess up the path to someone's house. All Town members who try to visit them will have their actions fail.
column5: Eliminate all opponents of the Mafia.

column4: Shout over someone, bullying them into keeping quiet for the following day. // You may not target the same player twice.
column5: Eliminate all opponents of the Mafia.

column4: Once per cycle, tickle a player to prevent them from using actions that phase.
column5: Eliminate all opponents of the Mafia.

column4: Visit a player and give them a makeover, choosing the role they appear as when investigated and the player they appear to visit for the duration of the night. // This does not affect death announcements.
column5: Eliminate all opponents of the Mafia.

column4: Visit a player and tell them a lie: overwrite, edit or augment their night results in any way you choose. // Post anything you want in announcements (it is clear it is from a player).
column5: Eliminate all opponents of the Mafia.

column4: Three times per game, you may tidy up a player's belongings during the night. If they die that night, their role will not be revealed. // From the belongings learn their role.
column5: Eliminate all opponents of the Mafia.

column4: Tell a player a joke each night.
column5: Tell a joke to every living player.

column4: You are assigned a random non-Power town role to guard. // Twice per game while alive, you may visit your ward and protect them.
column5: Keep your charge alive at least as long as any other town member.

column4: Visit a player to learn their role. // Guess the role of every living player. You die upon making a guess, whether it is correct or incorrect.
You must survive to the end of the game. // You cannot be targeted or investigated: anyone attempting to do so will have their action fail.
column5: Survive to the end of the game.

column4: Choose a player and boss them around, controlling their night action or roleblocking them. They will know they have been controlled. You also learn their role.
When you are lynched, everyone who voted for you is unable to use any actions the following night. // You may visit a player each phase and act generally naughty.

During the day, nullify the vote of one other player of your choice. // You may also choose to submit a private vote to override your public vote. // During the night, visit a player. If they are lynched the following day (and a member of the town) you win the game.
column5: Choose a Town member and get them lynched.

column4: You may deal a standard attack from Night 2 onwards. // With each kill, you gain defence, then a Strong attack, then a permanent disguise, then roleblock/control/redirect immunity, then a standard attack during the day.
column5: Kill every Town and Mafia member.

column4: You begin the game sick and with resistance to standard attacks; anyone who visits you also becomes sick. // Visit a player nightly to infect them and all their visitors. Learn the list of sick players. // When everyone alive is sick, it is announced that you are unkillable at night and may choose someone to die of sickness nightly.
column5: Kill every Town and Mafia member.

column4: Deal a Strong attack to a player. // You are passively protected from attacks.
column5: Kill every Town and Mafia member.

column4: You may freely deal a standard attack to a player (without visiting them). // At night, visit another player to disguise yourself as their role. During the day, cast a second vote in private. The first time you would die, you instead lose this ability.
column5: Kill every Town and Mafia member.
